metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10254 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
The allocate_elf function in common.h in elfutils before 0.168 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted ELF file, which triggers a memory allocation failure.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10254` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

elfutils - 0.168-0.2
libasm1 - 0.168-0.2
libdw1 - 0.168-0.2
libelf1 - 0.168-0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: elfutils package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.168-0.2').
